data.title: Great Happy Hour
data.text: Happy hour is great! Good drink and food specials, and awesome $1 burgers on Tuesday! The atmosphere is very fun, as well! Looking forward to the next time!

data.title: A chain the does it right
data.text: So many locally owned places in Ann Arbor that it always seems a shame to go to a chain.  But with a slightly later happy hour, we sometimes wind up here nonetheless.  And never been disappointed.  In a town full of mixologists that build you some ginger based cocktail - it is nice to go to a place with bartenders that can pour you a beer at the same time as they mix your wife a cocktail.  Everybody has always been service oriented during our visits and the food has always been good.  TV's everywhere and usually a lively atmosphere..  This place is perfect at being what it is trying to be.

data.title: Great before game
data.text: We were visiting from Colorado for the game and hung out here for food and drinks before walking up to the "Big House".   Everything was great..the service, food, drinks, tv for sporting events....we have a Bar Louie in Fort Collins, and this one was very good and don't understand why the low ranking on TA.

data.title: Great place to meet up with friends
data.text: This is a trendy, microbrew pub, spacious with tall and short tables as well as two outdoor patio areas that would be great for people watching.  It is a lively atmosphere and lots of tvs.  The server was friendly and though it was not busy, she was a little scarce.  There is a variety of food on the menu, appetizers, salads, sandwiches, burgers, entrees and daily specials.  Me and one of my table mates had the voodoo pasta.  With shrimp and andouille sausage, peppers, onions, cavatappi pasta and the voodoo sauce which was spicy, but not overly so; it was delicious.  One person enjoyed a burger, fries and a Caesar salad.  The other person had the macaroni and cheese sandwich on whole grain bread with pulled pork.  He said he would have like a little more pork on the sandwich.

data.title: Very Good Dining
data.text: We enjoyed selecting several menu items and sharing family-style. Best Voodoo Chicken I've ever had. Perfectly seasoned to provide the proper spicy  but not excessive kick. Lettuce wraps, as appetizer, excellent. Smoked brisket sliders - only for those in search of over the top smoked flavor. One bite was more than enough for me. Fish & Chips served with perfect French fries but the fish was much over-fried.

data.title: One of the Best burgers in town!
data.text: Great burgers and fries.  They also have wonderful salads, the Southwestern is my favorite.  It's a little loud unless your outside so it's tough to have conversations.

data.title: Great Place to Sit Outside and People Watch
data.text: Loved this on a sunny Saturday afternoon.  The usual Bar Louie fare - sandwiches, flatbreads and apps.  Club sandwich was good as were the nachos.  Grab a seat outside and watch the people parade on Liberty Street.

data.title: Great, lively atmosphere
data.text: We visited this popular bar/restaurant on a Friday night during the NCAA basketball tournament, and the place was rocking! We were lucky to snag two seats at the bar, and proceeded to have a wonderful evening of drinks, delicious food, great, friendly service, & LOTS of college basketball on the dozen or so TV screens positioned above and surrounding the bar. I've visited several Bar Louie facilities, & the appetizers & entrees are ALL good. I highly recommend this Bar Louie if you are in Ann Arbor!

data.title: "Strange name"
data.text: This is a dressed-up version of Your neighborhood Sports Bar. The island is right in the middle of the dining floor, which improves the sound quality of all ten TV screens. Pricey, but worth it.

data.title: Best to visit during happy hour
data.text: First of all, I really love this place.  Why the three stars?  Because my family of three went there on a Saturday for a casual dinner and were floored when we got our bill due to the very expensive beers.  I guess we should have asked the prices before ordering, so our bad.  This is a great place to visit during their happy hour.  I am gonna stay away on the weekends.

data.title: Afternoon Break
data.text: Mid afternoon break for a snack - great draft beer selection - flatbread with pear, pork, and fig was quite good!

data.title: It's ok sometimes.
data.text: The drinks here are pretty good, and I've had no complaints about the food, but as far as atmosphere, there are way better places in Ann Arbor.

data.title: Not up to snuff
data.text:
Visited Bar Louie for food only. Got the bowl of mussels in beer broth. They were pretty much inedible. There was a thick sheen of oil laying on top of the broth, the broth contained pickled rather than fresh jalapenos, the herb seasoning of the broth was off.
As for the mussels, they were not debearded, and this was a first for me at a restaurant. Debearding is step one in preparing mussels for consumption. Also, there were a few with badly broken shells that should have been discarded. Obviously, nobody is paying any attention in the kitchen. 
My waitress was good about my returning the mussels and not charging me for them. I know that BL has a bad rep for service, but in this case no complaints. I ordered the Buffalo wings. They were ok. A large order of about 10-12 good sized wings. I prefer the way that Bdubs prepares their wings, and BL's blue cheese dressing is very bland, almost flavorless. There was a hefty portion of carrot and celery sticks. Doubt if I will return, at least not soon.

data.title: Pricy chain restaurant/bar. Nothing special.
data.text:
I have been half a dozen times, but I never understand the appeal.

It's alright, just pricy and the food / drinks / atmosphere aren't anything extraordinary.

Even for their $1 burgers on Tuesdays, you end up paying $6 after ordering all the additional items and paying tip/tax.

data.title: Stopped during the Art Fair
data.text: My friend and I stopped for a hamburger during the Art Fair.  Got a seat outside and were waited on quickly. Food took a few extra minutes, but it was very crowded.  I would go again if I was ever in the neighborhood.

data.title: Service left a lot to be desired
data.text: Bar was busy but I stopped in for a cold drink during the Art Fair.  Bartenders behind the bar were too busy talking to each other to wait on customers.  Had to flag her down to order.  Never checked back with me.  Again had to flag her down.  Other patrons came and sat down at the bar (men) and were served immediately.  Ordered two appetizers and again, had to ask the bartender to check on the food and bring it out.  I will not be back.

data.title: Outdoor-like experience
data.text: Attended a large birthday get together in the back area of Bar Louie. It was a nice evening, so the side windows/doors of the area were open. This allowed a nice breeze and a neat outdoor type experience. It was a bit crazy in the beginning getting drinks- but the staff was great and the food was good. Nice time!

data.title: Happy Hour!
data.text: My husband and I ate and drank multiple drinks during happy hour.  We left with a bill less than 50.00!  It's in a perfect location to sit outside and people watch!  We had a blast!

data.title: Loud, fun, good food
data.text: This place is busy, pretty loud and has a fun, casual ambiance. Service and food are both good. Will return.

data.title: Ok food...rude waitress
data.text: I've been going to Bar Louie for years but I just say the new servers are giving this place a bad rep. Our waitress for the night, Jasmine, was not only rude and appeared to have an attitude all night but she forgot my date's food...brought it out 15 mins after I had received mine. After we finally received our food...Jasmine was no where in site. She never came to check on us. After an hour of sitting there, Jasmine finally came by the table. When I asked for a refill on my water and the check, she walked away without even acknowledging my requests. She came back about 20 mins later and asked us if we were all set - mind you with no water! Once we finally received the check it was beyond wrong! Our meal wasn't even listed correctly. I used to love bar Louie however after this last experience I'm hesitant to go again. FYI be prepared to spend at least 4 hours here if you get Jasmine!
